commands.title: Commands
commands.prefixTip: All TTS commands are prefixed with !tts.
commands.expandTip: Click any command row below to expand and see usage details.
commands.webDashboardTip: Broadcasters and viewers can also configure settings using the ChatVibes Web Dashboard.
commands.myvoiceTip: Viewers can set their own TTS preferences using the web UI by sending !myvoice in chat.

ttsStatus.name: !tts status
ttsStatus.description: Gets the current status of the TTS application for the channel.
ttsStatus.notes: Displays engine state, mode, queue length, default voice, pitch, speed, emotion, and language boost settings.

ttsVoices.name: !tts voices
ttsVoices.description: Provides a link to the documentation section for available TTS voices.

ttsLanguageslist.name: !tts languageslist
ttsLanguageslist.description: Provides a link to the documentation section for available TTS language boost options.

ttsCommands.name:
!tts commands
(Alias: !tts help)
ttsCommands.description: Provides a link to the full list of !tts subcommands.

ttsPrefs.name:
!tts prefs
(Aliases: !tts preferences, !tts settings)
ttsPrefs.description: Sends you a short-lived link to your personal TTS settings page.
ttsPrefs.feature1: Configure your own voice, pitch, speed, emotion, and language on a per-channel basis.
ttsPrefs.feature2: Includes a red-outlined "Danger Zone" where you can add yourself to the channel's TTS and/or Music ignore lists (only a moderator can undo this).
ttsPrefs.feature3: The bot posts the link publicly in chat; it is signed for you only and expires after first access or 10 minutes. The page is pre-filled with the current channel.

myvoice.name: !myvoice
myvoice.description: Sends you a short-lived link to your personal TTS settings page (equivalent to !tts prefs).
myvoice.notes: Same as !tts prefs. The bot posts the link publicly in chat; it is signed for you only and expires after first access or 10 minutes. The page is pre-filled with the current channel.

ttsOn.name:
!tts on
(Alias: !tts enable)
ttsOn.description: Enables the TTS engine. Messages and events may be spoken based on the current mode.

ttsOff.name:
!tts off
(Alias: !tts disable)
ttsOff.description: Disables the TTS engine entirely. No messages or events will be spoken.

ttsMode.name: !tts mode [all|command|bits_points_only]
ttsMode.allDesc: (Speak all chat messages & events; this is the default mode)
ttsMode.commandDesc: (Only speak on command or for events)
ttsMode.bitsPointsOnlyDesc: (Only speak Bits cheers & Channel Point redemptions)
ttsMode.notes:
all: All chat messages (not from ignored users or commands) and enabled events will be spoken, subject to the !tts permission setting.
command: Only messages triggered by specific TTS commands (like !tts <message>) or enabled events will be spoken. Regular chat is ignored.
bits_points_only: Only Bits cheers and Channel Point redemptions are read aloud. Regular chat and commands are ignored.

ttsPermission.name: !tts permission [everyone|all|mods]
ttsPermission.description: Sets a filter on who can trigger TTS when the bot is in all mode.
ttsPermission.notes:
everyone or all: Any user's chat message can be spoken. (Default)
mods: Only messages from moderators and the broadcaster will be spoken.
This does not affect command mode.

ttsBits.name: !tts bits [on|off|min <amount>]
ttsBits.description: Configures the Bits-for-TTS feature, allowing channels to require a minimum Cheer amount to trigger TTS.
ttsBits.onDesc: on: Enables Bits-for-TTS mode. Only messages with a sufficient cheer will be read.
ttsBits.minDesc: min <amount>: Sets the minimum number of Bits required (e.g., min 100).

channelPointsTTS.name: Channel Points → TTS
channelPointsTTS.description: Create a custom Twitch Channel Point reward for viewers to redeem with a message to be read aloud.
channelPointsTTS.noteText: This feature is configured exclusively through the ChatVibes Web Dashboard under the "Channel Points → TTS" section.
channelPointsTTS.step1: Streamer Setup: Enable the feature in the dashboard.
channelPointsTTS.step2: Reward Creation: The bot automatically creates a custom Channel Point reward on your Twitch channel.
channelPointsTTS.step3: Viewer Redemption: Viewers redeem the reward with a custom message, which gets read aloud.
channelPointsTTS.step4: Content Policy: Built-in filtering (length limits, link blocking, banned words).
channelPointsTTS.basicSettings: Basic Settings: Reward title, cost (points), prompt text, skip queue option
channelPointsTTS.advancedSettings: Advanced Settings: Global cooldown, per-stream limit, per-user limit
channelPointsTTS.contentPolicy: Content Policy: Min/max message length, block links, banned words list
channelPointsTTS.skipQueueDefault: Default Setting: This option is enabled by default for immediate TTS playback.
channelPointsTTS.skipQueueEnabled: When Enabled: Redemptions are processed immediately and do not appear in your Twitch "Reward Requests" queue.
channelPointsTTS.skipQueueDisabled: When Disabled: Redemptions appear in your Twitch dashboard for manual approval before TTS plays.
channelPointsTTS.skipQueueUseCase: Use Case: Enable for instant TTS, disable for moderation control.
channelPointsTTS.ttsModesText: Works with all TTS modes (All Messages, Commands Only, Bits/Points Only).
channelPointsTTS.requirementsText: Must grant channel:manage:redemptions and channel:read:redemptions OAuth scopes during initial dashboard setup.

ttsPause.name: !tts pause
ttsPause.description: Pauses the processing of the TTS event queue.
ttsPause.notes: New messages/events will still be added to the queue but won't be spoken until resumed.

ttsResume.name: !tts resume
ttsResume.description: Resumes processing of the TTS event queue if it was paused.

ttsClear.name: !tts clear
ttsClear.description: Clears all pending messages and events from the TTS queue.
ttsClear.notes: This command only removes messages waiting in the queue. It does not stop audio that is currently playing or actively being generated by the TTS engine.

ttsStop.name: !tts stop
ttsStop.description: Stops the currently playing or generating TTS audio.
ttsStop.note1: If TTS is currently speaking or generating audio, this command will attempt to stop it.
ttsStop.note2: Any user can stop a message if it was triggered by their own chat message.
ttsStop.note3: Moderators and the broadcaster can stop any TTS audio.
ttsStop.permission: Everyone for their own messages, Moderator for others

ttsVoice.name: !tts voice <voice_id|reset>
ttsVoice.description: Allows a user to set their preferred voice for messages they send.
ttsVoice.notes: Use reset to revert to the channel's default voice. Use !tts voices to get a link to available voice IDs.

ttsEmotion.name: !tts emotion <emotion_name|reset|auto>
ttsEmotion.description: Allows a user to set their preferred emotion for their messages.
ttsEmotion.notes: Valid emotions: neutral, happy, sad, angry, fearful, disgusted, surprised. Use reset for the channel default.

ttsLanguage.name:
!tts language <language|reset>
(Alias: !tts lang)
ttsLanguage.description: Sets your preferred language boost for TTS.

ttsIgnoreDel.name:
!tts ignore del <username>
(Aliases: delete, rem, remove)
ttsIgnoreDel.description: Removes the specified Twitch user from the TTS ignore list.

ttsIgnored.name: !tts ignored
ttsIgnored.description: Lists all users currently on the TTS ignore list for the channel.

ttsEvents.name: !tts events [on|off]
ttsEvents.description: Toggles whether Twitch events (like subscriptions, cheers, raids, etc.) are announced by TTS.

ttsDefaultvoice.name: !tts defaultvoice <voice_id|reset>
ttsDefaultvoice.description: Sets the default TTS voice for the channel.

ttsDefaultemotion.name: !tts defaultemotion <emotion_name|reset>
ttsDefaultemotion.description: Sets the default TTS emotion for the channel.

ttsDefaultlanguage.name: !tts defaultlanguage <language|reset>
ttsDefaultlanguage.description: Sets the default TTS language boost for the channel.

ttsDefaultpitch.name: !tts defaultpitch <value|reset>
ttsDefaultpitch.description: Sets the default TTS pitch for the channel.

ttsDefaultspeed.name: !tts defaultspeed <value|reset>
ttsDefaultspeed.description: Sets the default TTS speed for the channel.

musicPrompt.name: !music <prompt>
musicPrompt.description: Generates a short piece of music based on your prompt.

musicHelp.name: !music help
musicHelp.description: Provides a list of all music subcommands and their usage.

musicStatus.name: !music status
musicStatus.description: Shows the current status of music generation (enabled/disabled, mode, queue length).

musicClear.name: !music clear
musicClear.description: (Mod only) Clears all pending music generation requests from the queue.
